title.narrative: IUCN Naturbaserade lösningar för resilienta samhällen
IUCN Nature-based Solutions for Resilient Communities in the Western Balkans

description.narrative:
Overall objective of the project: Increased ecosystem and community resilience to climate change and environmental degradation in the Western Balkans Objective 1: Enhance knowledge and awareness of nature-based disaster risk reduction solutions among decision makers, natural resource managers and local communities Objective 2: Enhance integration of Nature-based Solutions and climate-smart planning into adaptation and disaster risk reduction policy Objective 3: Increase implementation of nature-based disaster risk reduction solutions
The contribution will demonstrate how nature based solutions can reduce vulernability to natural disasters and at the same time create livelihood opportunities for people depending on ecosystem services. The work on capacity building will build awareness about nature based solutions among general public and decision makers. The implementation of concrete nature based solutions in Serbia and Albania will serve as a demosntration site for other countries in the Region.

Den regionala insatsen ADAPT: Nature-based Solutions for Resilient Societies in the Western Balkans kommer att genomföras i Albanien, Kosovo, Bosnien och Hercegovina, Nord Makedonien, Montenegro och Serbien. Projektet syftar till att visa hur naturbaserade lösningar kan komplettera tekniska lösningar i arbetet med klimatanpassning och katastrofriskreducering. Projektet är ett pilotprojekt för att implementera naturbaserade lösningar i Albanien och Serbien, sprida kunskap om naturbaserade lösningar bland allmänhet och beslutsfattare i regionen.
Västra Balkan har erfarit en ökad frekvens av översvämningar, långa perioder med torka, markerosion och skogsbränder. Allvarliga översvämningar i Bosnien och Hercegovina och Serbien under 2014 resulterade i stor förstörelse av offentlig och privat infrastruktur samt drabbade hundratusentals hushåll, av vilka många, främst utsatta grupper blev beroende av humanitärt stöd. IPCC och European Environment Agency (IPCC) har identifierat västra Balkan, som ett av de mest utsatta områdena för effekterna av klimatförändringar i Europa. Enligt Millennium Ecosystem Assessment rapport 2005 underströks vikten av en hållbar förvaltning av ekosystem och markerade att enbart fokus på infrastrukturlösningar inte kommer att räcka för att tillgodose säkert vatten för konsumtion, hållbara och produktiva jordbrukssystem samt en hållbar urban utveckling. I Ministerdeklarationen från den andra högnivåpanelen för miljö och klimatåtgärder på västra Balkan, som godkändes på Bonn klimatkonferens 2017, erkändes klimatanpassning, som en av prioriteringarna för regionen.
Projektet fokuserar på områden utsatta för effekter av klimatförändringar som tex översvämningar och kommer därmed att bidra till arbetet med katastrofriskreducering, klimatanpassning, biologisk mångfald och miljöhänsyn. Indirekt kommer projektet genom ett väl integrerat jämställdhetsperspektiv och rättighetsperspektiv bidra till att visa hur miljöhänsyn kan skapa förutsättningar för ökad jämställdhet och demokratisering. Avsikten är också att denna insats utgör en start till ett större projekt att ansöka från gröna klimatfonden.

The ADAPT: Nature-based Solutions for Resilient Societies in the Western Balkan project aims to demonstrate how nature based solutions can complement engineering solutions in disaster risk reduction. The project will identify solutions on how nature can improve; water security; food security; solutions for disaster risk reduction; and solutions for climate adaptation in Western Balkan with pilots in Albania and Serbia and assessments in BiH, Montenegro, North Macedonia and Kosovo.
The 2016 European Environment Agency report on climate change, impacts and vulnerability in Europe considers south-eastern and southern Europe as highly prone to climate change effects, being a region with the highest impact of climate change and number of severely affected sectors and domains in Europe. The Ministerial Declaration of the 2nd High-Level Panel on the Environment and Climate Action in the Western Balkans, endorsed at the 2017 Bonn Climate Conference, recognized climate challenges as one of the priorities for action in the region. This reinforces the findings of the Intergovernmental Panel on Climate Change (IPCC) that also identified the Western Balkans as one of the most vulnerable areas to the effects of climate change. The Bonn declaration calls on the governments to take a more coordinated approach to existing initiatives and projects in the region, in terms of policy integration, capacity development, and action on the ground, as there is no evidence that such a coordinated action has taken place to date.
The 2005 Millennium Ecosystem Assessment, itself is a product of this growing awareness, provided a strong evidence base for subsequent policies to promote the conservation, restoration and sustainable management of ecosystems while also taking into account the increasing demands placed on ecosystem services (MillenniumEcosystem Assessment, 2005). The Millennium ecosystem assessment report, in fact, marked a new way of thinking recognizing that infrastructure alone is increasingly unlikely to provide future water security, sustainable agriculture and sustainable urban development.
Western Balkan has experienced an increased frequency in floods, extended periods of drought, soil erosion and forest fires, frequently turning into natural disasters, with communities and societies at large being affected in both the short- and long-term. Severe floods in BiH and Serbia in 2014 resulted in several dozens of casualties, causing the destruction of public and private infrastructures, as well as hitting hundreds of thousands of households, many of whom, mostly vulnerable groups had to rely on humanitarian assistance.
Nature-based solutions (NBS) is a newly coined umbrella concept (Albert et al., 2017). It relates to the use of nature for addressing a range of global environmental and social challenges, such as climate change and pollution of water systems (Cohen-Shacham et al., 2016). Sida decided to engage in a dialogue with IUCN since IUCN has developed the concept and is considered the leading agency on nature based solutions. NBS departs from a landscape approach to idenitfy ways to reduce impact of for example, floods and droughts. Sweden is a supporter and has signed off on the The Nature-Based Solutions for Climate Manifesto that was launched at the The UN Climate Action Summit, convened by UN Secretary-General on 23 September 2019. While multiple EU and national policy instruments explicitly acknowledge nature-based solutions and related concepts, significant potential remains to increase the level of support for NBS uptake and mainstreaming. In the most recent round of research funding for Horizon 2020 Research and Innovation (2016-2017), the workprogramme highlighted NBS as a key theme, along other themes like climate services, water, and raw materials. The European Commission underlines that NBS can transform environmental and societal challenges into innovation opportunities, by turning natural capital into a source for green growth and sustainable development. For the commission, NBS are sustainable measures that aim to simultaneously meet environmental, societal and economic objectives, which should help maintain and enhance natural capital (European Commission 2015).

participating-org.narrative: IUCN/International Union for Conservation of Nature and Natural Resources/The World Conservation Union
International Union for the Conservation of Nature

tag.narrative: 11.5 - By 2030, significantly reduce the number of deaths and the number of people affected and substantially decrease the direct economic losses relative to global gross domestic product caused by disasters, including water-related disasters, with a focus on protecting the poor and people in vulnerable situations.

11.5 - Till 2030 väsentligt minska antalet dödsfall och antalet människor som drabbas av katastrofer, inklusive vattenrelaterade katastrofer. Även tillse att de direkta ekonomiska förlusterna till följd av sådana katastrofer, i form av lägre global BNP, minskar väsentligt. Särskilt fokus bör ligga på att skydda de fattiga och människor i utsatta situationer.
13.1 - Strengthen resilience and adaptive capacity to climate-related hazards and natural disasters in all countries.
13.1 - Stärka motståndskraften mot och förmågan till anpassning till klimatrelaterade faror och naturkatastrofer i alla länder.
13.2 - Integrate climate change measures into national policies, strategies and planning.
13.2 - Integrera klimatåtgärder i politik, strategier och planering på nationell nivå.

13.3 - Förbättra utbildningen, medvetenheten och den mänskliga och institutionella kapaciteten vad gäller begränsning av klimatförändringarna, klimatanpassning, begränsning av klimatförändringarnas konsekvenser samt tidig varning.
13.3 - Improve education, awareness-raising and human and institutional capacity on climate change mitigation, adaptation, impact reduction and early warning.
15.9 - By 2020, integrate ecosystem and biodiversity values into national and local planning, development processes, poverty reduction strategies and accounts.
15.9 - Senast 2020 integrera ekosystemens och den biologiska mångfaldens värden i nationella och lokala planerings- och utvecklingsprocesser, i strategier för fattigdomsminskning samt i räkenskaper.
6.6 - By 2020, protect and restore water-related ecosystems, including mountains, forests, wetlands, rivers, aquifers and lakes.
6.6 - Senast 2020 skydda och återställa de vattenrelaterade ekosystemen, däribland berg, skogar, våtmarker, floder, akviferer och sjöar.
